title: Subashree Kothandaraman
text:
Assistant Professor
SRM University-AP, Andhra Pradesh
Email: subashree.k@srmap.edu.in, subakrupa112@gmail.com
I am an Assistant Professor at the Department of Environmental Science and Engineering at SRM University-AP. My research focuses on understanding ecosystem responses to climate change and land-atmosphere interactions.
Keywords: Forest ecology, Carbon storage, Vegetation modelling, Climate change
Study sites: Southern Western Ghats
 Publications  ORCiD  ResearchGate  Website




 Back to member directory

title: Navendu Page
text:
Scientist
Thackeray Wildlife Foundation
Email: navendu.page@gmail.com
Navendu Page is a Scientist at the Thackeray Wildlife Foundation. He is a plant ecologist and a field botanist. He devotes most of time exploring plants across different parts of the country and learning about their ecology, distribution and taxonomy. He also has a keen interest in developing user-friendly resources for plant identification.
Study sites: Plant Ecology, Biogeography, Community Ecology, Field Botany
 Publications




 Back to member directory

title: Mahesh Sankaran
text:
Professor
National Centre for Biological Sciences
Email: mahesh@ncbs.res.in
Mahesh Sankaran heads the Biodiversity and Ecosystems Ecology Research group at the National Centre for Biological Sciences, Bengaluru. His research focuses on understanding interactions and feedbacks between climate, biogeochemistry, fires and herbivory, and ecosystem properties. He works across a range of ecosystems from grasslands and savannas to forests.
Keywords: savanna ecology, grasslands, tropical forests, climate change, carbon cycling, tree demography, plant-herbivore interactions
Study sites: Western Ghats, Eastern Ghats, Western Himalayas, Eastern Himalayas, Andaman Islands.
 Publications  ORCiD  ResearchGate  Website




 Back to member directory

title: Javid Dar
text:
Assistant Professor
SRM University-AP, Andhra Pradesh
Email: javidahmad.d@srmap.edu.in, javiddar29@gmail.com
I am working as an Assistant Professor and heads the TEaM (Terrestrial Ecology and Modelling) Lab group at the Department of Environmental Science and Engineering, SRM University-AP. My research focuses on monitoring and modelling the biodiversity, and carbon and nitrogen dynamics in temperate and tropical forests in response to climate change.
Keywords: Forest ecology, Carbon dynamics, Ecosystem modelling
Study sites: Eastern Ghats of Andhra Pradesh, Central India, (Madhya Pradesh and Western Himalayas (Jammu and Kashmir)
 Publications  ResearchGate  Website




 Back to member directory

title: Akshay Surendra
text:
Independent researcher

Email: akshaysurendra1@gmail.com
Akshay Surendra is a community ecologist interested in forests and birds, ecological restoration and conservation science.
Keywords: community ecology, plant soil interactions, trees, birds, land use change
 Publications  ResearchGate  Website

title: Abhishek Gopal
text:
PhD student
CSIR: Centre for Cellular and Molecular Biology
Email: abhishekgopal1993@gmail.com 
Abhishek is an engineer turned ecologist, keen on plant-animal interactions and plant community ecology. He has previously researched these themes in Anamalais and in Narcondam. Currently pursuing a PhD, he is exploring the evolution of woody plants in the Western Ghats. He has a soft spot for Ficus species and large old trees and would eventually like to work towards forest restoration.
Keywords: Biogeography, Evolutionary Ecology, Community ecology, Plant-animal interaction, and Tropical ecology
Study sites: Across Western Ghats and Eastern Ghats as part of the PhD. Previously worked in Anamalais and Narcondam.
 Publications  Website




 Back to member directory

title: Ankitha Jayanth
text:
Research Assistant
Ahmedabad University and University of Oklahoma
Email: ankitha.jayanth@gmail.com
Ankitha Jayanth is interested in focusing on how land use change can affect bird habitat and nesting choices. She is also interested in making fundamental ecological data more accessible to allow for better collaborative and comprehensive based studies.
Keywords: Urban ecology, community ecology, bird habitat preferences and nest predation
Study sites: Ahmedabad, Bangalore
 ORCiD




 Back to member directory

title: Krishna Anujan
text:
Postdoc
Smithsonian Institution
Email: anujank@si.edu
My research focuses on understanding and predicting the effects of global change drivers on tropical forest community dynamics. I am also interested in working towards knowledge equity in the tropical forest sciences through collaborative science and creative outputs.
Keywords: community ecology, forest dynamics, tree growth, ecological forecasting, Bayesian models
Study sites: Andaman Islands, coastal Kerala
 GitHub  ORCiD  ResearchGate  Website




 Back to member directory

title: Mohammed Latif Khan
text:
Senior Professor
Dr. Harisingh Gour Central University, Madhya Pradesh
Email: khanml61@gmail.com, khanml@yahoo.com
Over the course of my career, I have demonstrated exceptional dedication to the study of forest regeneration, biodiversity, and ecosystem services, addressing critical issues such as carbon sequestration, plant invasion and the impact of climate change on biodiversity. I have published 227 articles in prestigious journals such as Nature (3 articles), PNAS, USA (2 articles), Nature Ecology & Evolution (2 articles), Nature Communication (2 articles), Nature Plants, Science Advances, Global Ecology and Biogeography (2 articles), Journal of Ecology, Nature Scientific Report, Critical Review in Biotechnology, The Science of the Total Environment, Biotropica, Conservation Biology etc., five books and 66 chapters. My scholarly achievements have been recognized on a global scale, earning me prestigious accolades, fellowships, and awards. I received 7th Visitor Award for Research in Biological Sciences, conferred by the President of India on 10th July, 2023. I am fellow of National Academy of Agricultural Sciences, New Delhi, Linnean Society, London, UK, Royal Society of Biology, London, UK. I am also featured in the list of 2% Scientists published by Stanford University, USA.
Keywords: forest ecology, conservation biology, sustainable management, ecorestoration, ecosystem services, molecular genetics genetics and phylogeny. threatened (RET) plant species,
Study sites: Eastern Himalayas, North Eastern Region, Central India
 Publications  ORCiD  ResearchGate  Website




 Back to member directory

title: Neha Mohanbabu
text:
Postdoc
Utrecht University
Email: nehamohanbabu@gmail.com
Neha Mohanbabu is a postdoctoral researcher at Utrecht University. She is broadly interested in understanding how species interactions and ecosystem functions are influenced by ongoing global changes and biodiversity loss. Her research uses theoretical models, experimental data, observational field data, and more recently, remote sensing techniques to study both spatial and temporal trends in responses of plant communities.
Keywords:  Biodiversity, Global changes, species interactions, functional traits
 Publications  ORCiD  Website




 Back to member directory

title: Tanaya Nair
text:
PhD student 
University of Oxford
Email: tanaya.nair@ouce.ox.ac.uk
Tanaya Nair (she/her) is a scholar at the Oxford India Centre for Sustainable Development and is reading a DPhil in the School of Geography and the Environment at University of Oxford. Her project is on measuring nutrient flows in tropical forests and savannas in Africa and Asia. Besides this, she is actively researching and workshopping how art and science can come together through participatory interventions to roll out research more meaningfully and urgently in the world.
Keywords: nutrient cycling, tropical ecology, macroecology, nature recovery, microclimate modelling
Study sites: Western Ghats
 Publications  ORCiD  ResearchGate  Website




 Back to member directory

title: Satyam Verma
text:
Assistant Professor
Dr. Harisingh Gour Central University, Madhya Pradesh
Email: satyam.verma@dhsgsu.edu.in; satyamverma69@gmail.com
I am an Assistant Professor at the Department of Environmental Sciences, Dr. Harisingh Gour Vishwavidyalaya, Sagar, MP. My research attempts to bridge field-based ecological studies with spatial data to understand fire ecology, climate change impacts, and forest landscape dynamics. I have been working in the forests of Central India and have also had the opportunity to work in the Western Ghats.
Keywords: Fire Ecology, Climate Change, Landscape Ecology, Spatial Modeling, Wildlife Conservation
Study sites: Central India (Satpuda Tiger Reserve, Panna Landscape), Western Ghats
 Publications  ORCiD  ResearchGate  Website




 Back to member directory
